gameworld

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameworld.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a user controlled player within the game
    Author:
    Jasen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • performAction

        protected Container performAction()
        Used to interact with containers. Will attempt to unlock the container if it is locked
        Returns:
        container that the player want to interact with

      • useItem

        public void useItem(Item item)
        Use the item in the players inventory at the specified index
        Parameters:
        index - of item in the inventory

      • addItem

        public boolean addItem(Item item)
        add an item to the players inventory. This will add the item into the players first available slot in the inventory
        Parameters:
        item - to add
        Returns:
        true if the item was successfully added

      • removeItem

        public void removeItem(int index)
        Removes item form inventory at specified index
        Parameters:
        index - - index of item to remove

      • swapItems

        public void swapItems(int first,
                      int second)
        Swap the items at the given indices in the inventory
        Parameters:
        first - - index of first item
        second - - index of second item

      • attack

        protected boolean attack()
        Make this player attack the player in the tile in front of them
        Returns:
        true if the attack was successful

      • respawn

        private void respawn()
        Drops the players inventory on the ground and then respawns the player in the specified starting location.

      • dropFromInv

        protected boolean dropFromInv(int index)
        Removes an item from the players inventory and places it on the ground. Places the item on the tile the player is standing on
        Parameters:
        index - of the item to drop
        Returns:
        true if the item was successfully removed

      • pickupItem

        protected boolean pickupItem()
        Player attempts to pick-up the item on the tile in front of them
        Returns:
        true if the item was successfully added

      • inventoryFull

        private boolean inventoryFull()
        check the players inventory for a free space
        Returns:
        true if the players inventory is full

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(Game.Direction dir)
        Get the tile that is in a direction from the player
        Parameters:
        dir - - direction to get the tile from
        Returns:
        the tile in the direction

      • move

        public boolean move(Game.Direction dir,
                    boolean clientSide)
        Moves the player if a direction if it can
        Parameters:
        dir - - direction to move
        Returns:
        true if the player moved otherwise false

      • calcDir

        private Game.Direction calcDir(Game.Direction dir)
        Calculates the direction the player should move based on the direction of the camera(direction field)
        Parameters:
        dir - - the direction the player is trying to move in
        Returns:
        the direction the player should move in

      • moveDir

        private Game.Direction moveDir(Game.Direction dir)
        updates the players position field to one tile in a direction
        Parameters:
        dir - to move

      • changeDirection

        public void changeDirection(int key)
        Change the direction of the player based on the key that was pressed and the direction the camera is currently facing. Accepts KeyEvent.VK_E and KeyEvent.VK_Q
        Parameters:
        key - - key press

      • setFacing

        public void setFacing(Game.Direction dir)
        set the direction that the player is facing
        Parameters:
        dir -

        health -
